briefTitle: Metformin for the Prevention of Episodic Migraine (MPEM)
officialTitle: Metformin for the Prevention of Episodic Migraine: a Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Crossover Study

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

1. age 18-65 years
2. a diagnosis of migraine with or without aura for \>1 year according to the International Classification of Headache Disorders-IIIb

Exclusion Criteria:

1. a diagnosis of diabetes mellitus or polycystic ovarian syndrome
2. overuse of acute migraine treatments
3. failure to respond to 3 or more classes of preventive drug treatments
4. change in dose of migraine-preventive medication within 2 months of beginning the baseline diary phase
5. significant somatic or psychiatric disease
6. known alcohol or other substance abuse
7. pregnant or breastfeeding.

primary.description: Total number of moderate and severe headache days
primary.timeFrame: Baseline through end of study for a total of approximately 32 weeks

secondary.measure: Greater Than >50% Reduction in Migraine Days on Metformin
secondary.description: Percentage of patients whose migraines reduced by at least 50% on Metformin.
Total number of subjects with treatment-related adverse events
secondary.timeFrame: Baseline through end of study for a total of approximately 32 weeks
